title: Delightfully welcome Krishna on your tongue | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.text: We already said that chanting is like welcoming the Lord. So there's a feeling
in welcoming. You delightfully welcome. Is it not? If you invite somebody to your
house, you delightfully welcome them. Not that you're, you know, like a very, somehow
okay, I have to invite them. Not like that. You delightfully invite them. Two ways you
can do. Delightfully you can invite them. Or some social obligation is there. We have
to call them, let them come. No, it's not like that. You have to delightfully.
Call them. So in the same way, the Holy name is the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Supreme
Personality is no supreme. There's no person superior to Him.
So that Supreme Personality of Godhead we also used another important word which brings
out.
a kind of a, we can relate with that feeling. What is that? Like a V-I-P. V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-V-I-P.
So infinite V's, I-P. So Krishna is like a I-I-P, most important person, infinitely important
person. Suppose in your house someone comes. Let's say somebody whom you admire so much
and he is a role model for you. He comes to your house. You will be delighted. Not a.
You will be delighted to receive him.
And you will relish his association.
You will want to relish his association.
You want to hear from him or you want to relish his association.
And then you are going to be very enthusiastic till he leaves, you want to be enthusiastic
to serve him.
So that you know, there is a relationship built, there is a pleasure of serving him.
So take this, understand these three things.
One is delight, delightfully welcoming, relishing the association, enthusiastically serving.
Three things.
First, it is the association that wants to serve you.
Second, it is the association that wants to serve you.
Third, it is the association that wants to serve you.
